description: Home Security Intelligence - Operations Dashboard with all metrics

panels.description: Key metrics overview for Operations Dashboard

options.content:
### Executive Summary Guide

**Key Metrics to Monitor:**
- **GPU Utilization**: Target 60-80%. Above 90% indicates potential bottleneck; below 30% suggests underutilization
- **Inference FPS**: Healthy range is 1-10 FPS depending on camera count. Zero indicates pipeline stall
- **Detection Queue**: Should stay below 50. Above 100 indicates backpressure; investigate AI service health
- **Pipeline P95 Latency**: Target under 30s. Above 60s triggers SLO breach alerts
- **GPU Temp**: Safe under 75C. Warning at 80C. Critical at 85C - thermal throttling may occur
- **VRAM Usage**: Keep under 80% to avoid OOM errors. Spikes above 90% require immediate attention
15m 1h 6h 24h 7d

panels.description: Alert thresholds and system health meanings

options.content:
### System Health Alert Thresholds

**Health Status:** Binary indicator from blackbox probe. Green = all endpoints responding, Red = service unreachable

**Alert Thresholds:**
| Metric | Warning | Critical | Action |
|--------|---------|----------|--------|
| Health Status | N/A | Unhealthy | Check container logs, restart service |
| Uptime | <99% | <95% | Review incident timeline |
| Database | Slow queries >100ms | Connection failures | Check pg_stat_activity, connection pool |
| Redis | Memory >70% | Connection refused | Check maxmemory policy, client count |
| Active Cameras | <expected count | 0 | Check RTSP streams, network connectivity |

panels.description: Alerts suppressed by silences or inhibition rules
panels.title: Suppressed Alerts

panels.description: Cumulative notification failures since Alertmanager start. This is a monotonically increasing counter that only resets on Alertmanager restart. Historical spikes (e.g., 103 failures in Jan 2025) were caused by ai-florence crash loop (NEM-3497) and Loki stream limit (NEM-3496), resolved in commit c0ce9fd65. To monitor recent failure trends, use the 'Notification Failures by Integration' time series panel below.
panels.title: Total Failures

panels.title: Host Disk Usage

options.content:
### Infrastructure Health Thresholds

**Host System Thresholds:**
| Metric | Warning | Critical | Impact |
|--------|---------|----------|--------|
| CPU Usage | >80% | >95% | AI inference slowdown, queue backpressure |
| Memory Usage | >85% | >95% | OOM risk, container eviction |
| Disk Usage | >80% | >90% | Video/log storage failure |
| System Load | >2x cores | >4x cores | Process scheduling delays |

**Container Resource Limits:**
- Backend: 4 CPU, 8GB RAM
- YOLO26: 2 CPU, 4GB RAM + GPU
- Nemotron: 2 CPU, 8GB RAM + GPU
- PostgreSQL: 2 CPU, 4GB RAM

**Memory Leak Detection:**
- Watch for steady memory increase over hours without release
- Check container restarts - frequent OOM kills indicate leak
- Use `/api/admin/metrics/memory` for detailed memory breakdown

options.content:
### Risk Analysis Metrics

**What these metrics track:**
- **Events Acknowledged**: Security events marked as reviewed by operators
- **Risk Distribution**: Breakdown of events by risk level

**Why these matter:**
- Acknowledgement rate shows operator engagement
- Unacknowledged high-risk events need immediate attention
- Risk trends reveal security patterns

**Criticality:** HIGH - Security monitoring effectiveness depends on operator response.

**SLA targets:** High/Critical events acknowledged within 15 minutes

### Queue Health Metrics

**What these metrics track:**
- **Overflow Events**: Queue at max capacity, backpressure applied
- **Items Dropped**: Data loss due to overflow, TTL expiry, or validation
- **Items Rejected**: Validation failures at queue entry
- **DLQ Moves**: Failed items requiring manual investigation

**Why these matter:**
- Overflow = pipeline can't keep up with incoming load
- Drops = data loss, investigate root cause immediately
- Rejections = upstream sending malformed data
- DLQ = processing failures needing operator attention

**Criticality:** CRITICAL - Queue issues cause data loss and pipeline stalls.

**Alert thresholds:** Any drops > 0 = investigate, DLQ > 100 items = manual review required

panels.description: Current number of images waiting in the detection queue
panels.title: Detection Queue Depth

panels.description: Current number of batches waiting in the analysis queue
panels.title: Analysis Queue Depth

options.content:
### Worker Health Metrics

**What these metrics track:**
- **Worker Crashes** (`hsi_worker_crashes_total`): Unexpected worker failures requiring automatic recovery
- **Worker Restarts** (`hsi_worker_restarts_total`): All restart events (crash recovery, scheduled, manual)
- **Circuit Breaker Trips** (`hsi_circuit_breaker_trips_total`): Protection activations when downstream services fail

**Why these matter:**
- High crash rates indicate code bugs or resource exhaustion
- Restart patterns reveal system stability issues
- Circuit breaker trips prevent cascade failures

**Criticality:** HIGH - Worker health directly impacts pipeline throughput and reliability.

**Alert thresholds:** Crashes > 5/hr = investigate, Circuit trips > 10/hr = service degradation

panels.description: Total worker restarts by worker name
panels.title: Total Worker Restarts

panels.description: Total worker crashes by worker name
panels.title: Total Worker Crashes

panels.title: Worker Restart/Crash Rate

panels.description: Queue management guidance for DLQ and workers

options.content:
### DLQ & Worker Health Guide

**Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) Management:**
- **DLQ Depth = 0**: Healthy - no failed jobs
- **DLQ Depth 1-10**: Warning - investigate failure reasons in logs
- **DLQ Depth >10**: Critical - systematic issue; check worker health and external dependencies

**DLQ Recovery Steps:**
1. Check `hsi_dlq_failure_reason` metric for common error patterns
2. Review worker logs for stack traces
3. Use `/api/admin/dlq/replay` to retry failed jobs after fixing root cause
4. Use `/api/admin/dlq/purge` to clear obsolete entries (data loss!)

**Worker Health Indicators:**
- **Worker State**: `running` (healthy), `stopped` (needs restart), `crashed` (check logs)
- **Consecutive Failures**: >3 failures triggers circuit breaker
- **Processing Rate**: Should match incoming queue rate; large gaps indicate bottleneck

panels.description: Number of failed jobs in dead letter queue by queue name
panels.title: DLQ Depth

panels.description: Rate of items being moved to dead letter queue due to failures
panels.title: DLQ Processing Rate

panels.description: Circuit breaker state meanings and recovery guidance

options.content:
### Circuit Breaker State Guide

**State Meanings:**
- **CLOSED (Green)**: Healthy - requests flowing normally to downstream services
- **OPEN (Red)**: Failing - circuit tripped due to consecutive failures; requests rejected to prevent cascade
- **HALF-OPEN (Orange)**: Testing - allowing limited requests to check if service recovered

**Circuit Breaker Behavior:**
| State | Behavior | Recovery |
|-------|----------|----------|
| CLOSED | All requests pass through | N/A |
| OPEN | All requests fail-fast (no downstream call) | Wait for timeout (default 30s) |
| HALF-OPEN | 1 test request allowed | Success -> CLOSED, Failure -> OPEN |

**When Circuit Opens:**
1. Check downstream service health (Nemotron, YOLO26, database)
2. Review error logs for root cause
3. Circuit auto-recovers after timeout; no manual intervention needed
4. High trip rate indicates persistent issue - investigate immediately

panels.description: Rate of circuit breaker trips indicating downstream service failures
panels.title: Circuit Breaker Trips

options.content:
### Cost & Efficiency Metrics

**What these metrics track:**
- **Budget Utilization**: Percentage of daily/monthly budget consumed
- **Token Cost Rate**: USD spent on LLM inference per camera

**Why these matter:**
- Budget tracking prevents unexpected bills
- Per-camera costs reveal optimization opportunities
- Trend analysis helps capacity planning

**Criticality:** MEDIUM - Financial visibility, not immediate operational impact.

**Healthy ranges:** Daily budget < 80% by EOD, Monthly < 90%, Cost/camera stable over time

panels.description: Estimated monthly cost based on current usage
panels.title: Monthly Cost

panels.description: Total Nemotron token cost in USD
panels.title: Token Cost Rate by Camera

panels.title: Slow Log Entries

panels.title: Last Slow Log ID

options.content:
### Real User Monitoring (RUM) Metrics

**What these metrics measure:**
- **FCP (First Contentful Paint)**: Time until first content renders - indicates initial load speed
- **LCP (Largest Contentful Paint)**: Time until largest content element renders - key Core Web Vital
- **Page Load Time**: Total time to fully load the page
- **CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift)**: Visual stability score - measures unexpected layout shifts

**Criticality:** HIGH - These are Core Web Vitals that directly impact user experience and SEO rankings.

**Healthy thresholds:** FCP < 1.8s (good), LCP < 2.5s (good), Page Load < 3s (good), CLS < 0.1 (good)

### SLI/SLO Latency Metrics

**Service Level Indicators (SLIs):**
- **Analysis Latency P95/P99**: Time for LLM analysis of detection batches (Nemotron)
- **Detection Latency P95/P99**: Time for YOLO26 object detection

**Why these matter:**
- P95 = 95% of requests complete within this time (typical user experience)
- P99 = 99% of requests (catches outliers affecting 1% of users)

**Criticality:** CRITICAL - These define system reliability and directly impact SLO compliance.

**SLO Targets:** Analysis P95 < 2s, Detection P95 < 500ms, P99 within 2x P95

panels.description: Burn rate > 1 means consuming error budget faster than planned
panels.title: API Availability Burn Rate

panels.description: Documentation for AI Container Health metrics

options.content:
### AI Container Health Metrics

**What these metrics track:**
- **LLM Context Utilization**: How much of the model's context window is used per request
- **AI Container CPU/Memory**: Resource usage of AI inference containers

**Why these matter:**
- High context utilization may cause truncation or degraded responses
- Resource usage indicates scaling needs

**Criticality:** MEDIUM - Impacts analysis quality and container stability.

**Healthy ranges:** Context utilization < 80%, Container memory < 90%

options.content:
### Synthetic Monitoring Metrics

**What these metrics track:**
- **Probe Success Rate**: Whether synthetic checks pass/fail
- **Estimated Uptime**: Percentage availability based on probe results (1h window)
- **Probe Duration**: Time taken for synthetic checks to complete

**Why these matter:**
- Synthetic monitoring detects outages before users report them
- Uptime calculation provides SLA compliance data
- Duration trends reveal performance degradation

**Criticality:** HIGH - Early warning system for service availability.

**Healthy thresholds:** Uptime > 99.9%, Probe duration < 2s
